member.summary: Quickly create a new IFsiSession with some sane defaults
Create a new IFsiSession by specifying all fsi arguments manually.

member.name: M:FSharp.Formatting.Internal.FsiSession.ChangeCurrentDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Change the current directory (so that relative paths within scripts work properly). Returns a handle to change the current directory back to it's initial state (Because this will change the current directory of the currently running code as well!).

member.name: M:FSharp.Formatting.Internal.FsiSession.Cd(System.String)
member.summary: Change the current directory (so that relative paths within scripts work properly). Returns a handle to change the current directory back to it's initial state (Because this will change the current directory of the currently running code as well!).

member.name: P:FSharp.Formatting.Internal.FsiOptions.WarnLevel
member.summary: Sets a warning level (0 to 5). The default level is 3. Each warning is given a level based on its severity. Level 5 gives more, but less severe, warnings than level 1. Level 5 warnings are: 21 (recursive use checked at runtime), 22 (let rec evaluated out of order), 45 (full abstraction), and 52 (defensive copy). All other warnings are level 2.

member.name: P:FSharp.Formatting.Internal.FsiOptions.Default
member.summary: Sets a warning level (0 to 5). The default level is 3. Each warning is given a level based on its severity. Level 5 gives more, but less severe, warnings than level 1. Level 5 warnings are: 21 (recursive use checked at runtime), 22 (let rec evaluated out of order), 45 (full abstraction), and 52 (defensive copy). All other warnings are level 2.
